newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila says to raise power rates on peso fall.
newsitem.headline: Manila says to raise power rates on peso fall.

text.p: Philippine Energy Secretary Francisco Viray said on Monday he expected domestic power rates to rise after the peso tumbled to a new low when the central bank allowed it to float in a wider band.
"There will be (an increase) but we don't know how much it will be at this point," Viray told reporters, adding that power rates also depend on the price of crude oil.
The Philippines relies mainly on crude imports for its power needs.
"For all you know, a drop in the price of crude may offset this (peso depreciation)," he added. "Right now, it's hard to speculate."
The peso plunged to 29.75 to the dollar in late morning trading on Monday after the central bank last week effectively devalued the currency.
